errors.title: Debug Crash
errors.analysis: This is a manually triggered debug crash for testing crash handling functionality.
suggestions: This is not a real game crash; no need for concern.

patterns.value: unable to create new native thread

errors.title: Out of Memory
errors.analysis: The game crashed due to insufficient memory. The Java Virtual Machine could not allocate enough memory to run the game.
suggestions: Try increasing the memory allocated to the game (set JVM arguments in the version management)
Close other memory-intensive programs such as browsers, video players, etc.
Reduce the render distance and graphics settings in-game
If using many mods, consider reducing the number of mods
For 32-bit systems, it is recommended to upgrade to a 64-bit system to support more memory

errors.title: Mod Conflict
errors.analysis: Mod conflict or incompatibility detected. This usually occurs because multiple mods modify the same game content, or the mod versions do not match the game version.
suggestions: Carefully check the specific mod names mentioned in the crash log
Try removing recently added mods and test them one by one
Ensure all mod versions match the current game version
Check mod dependencies to ensure all required mods are installed
Visit the mod's official page for compatibility information

errors.title: Missing Dependency
errors.analysis: Detected that mod {source} requires dependency {target}, version requirement {version}.
suggestions: Click the button below to automatically search and open {target}.
If the automatic search fails, manually download the corresponding version of {target}.

errors.title: Incompatible Mod Version
errors.analysis: Detected that mod {source} ({mod_version}) is incompatible with the current Minecraft version {mc_version}. The mod's required MC version range is {mc_range}.
suggestions: Please download a version of {source} that is compatible with the current Minecraft version
If you wish to keep this mod version, switch to a Minecraft version within the {required_mc} range instead
Click the button below to search and open {source}

errors.title: Missing Dependency
errors.analysis: Detected that mod {source} requires dependency {target}, version requirement {version}.
suggestions: Click the button below to automatically search and open {target}.
If the automatic search fails, manually download the corresponding version of {target}.

errors.title: Missing Dependencies
errors.analysis: The game is missing necessary dependency files or libraries. This may be due to incomplete game files or missing dependencies for certain mods.
suggestions: Try re-downloading and reinstalling the game version
Check if any necessary library files are missing (in the libraries folder)
Ensure the game files are complete and have not been mistakenly deleted by antivirus software
If using mods, check that all required dependencies are installed
Try using the launcher's repair function to re-download missing files

errors.title: Entity Tick Crash
errors.analysis: Detected a crash involving entity {entity_type} ({entity_name}, ID {entity_id}) at coordinates {entity_pos} in dimension {dimension} (entity tick). This is usually caused by abnormal entity logic or related mod injection.
suggestions: If this is a custom or mod-added entity, check if its tick logic throws an exception
Try removing or updating mods related to this entity
If unable to enter the world, restore from a backup or remove the entity from the save file
If it's a rendering thread crash, check client-side rendering-related mods

patterns.value: compiled by a more recent version

errors.title: Java Version Mismatch
errors.analysis: Java version mismatch. The game requires a higher Java version to run. The currently used Java version is too old to load class files compiled with a newer version.
suggestions: Check the Java version required by the game (usually in the game description)
Select the correct Java version in the launcher settings
Minecraft 1.17+ recommends Java 17
Minecraft 1.20.5+ requires Java 21
If the current Java version is too low (e.g., Java 8), download and install a higher version of Java

errors.title: Graphics Driver Issue
errors.analysis: Graphics driver issue. The game cannot correctly initialize the graphics rendering system.
suggestions: Update your graphics drivers to the latest version
If using a laptop, ensure the game is using the dedicated GPU, not the integrated one
Try adding `-Dorg.lwjgl.opengl.Display.allowSoftwareOpenGL=true` to the launch arguments
Check if the OpenGL version meets the game requirements (typically OpenGL 3.2+)
For older graphics cards, consider using optimization mods like OptiFine

errors.title: Network Connection Issue
errors.analysis: Network connection issue. The game cannot connect to the server or download necessary resources.
suggestions: Check if your network connection is working properly
If connecting to a multiplayer server, verify the server address and port are correct
Try disabling firewall or antivirus network interception
Check if a proxy server needs to be configured
If downloading resources fails, try switching the download source

errors.title: Corrupted World Save
errors.analysis: World save file corruption. There is an issue with some chunk data in the game world.
suggestions: Try restoring the world from a backup
If only some chunks are corrupted, you can delete the corresponding region files (terrain will regenerate)
Regularly backup important worlds to prevent data loss
Check the hard drive for bad sectors or insufficient space
